alert.note: Alert for Dooly; Houston (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:10AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Dooly and southwestern Houston Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 1009 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Byromville, or 9 miles north of Vienna, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Unadilla, Byromville, Pinehurst, Lilly, Dooling and Elko. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
